title: IBM Cloud VLANs
introduction: Virtual Local Area Networks (VLANs) are used by IBM Cloud to isolate broadcast traffic on the public and private networks.

links.title: Ordering premium VLANs
links.description: When you're ready to explore a more complex network topology, you can add more VLANs to isolate traffic between groups of devices.

links.title: Linking secure private networks over the IBM network
links.description: This tutorial demonstrstes how to link secure private networks using VLANs.

section_highlights.title: Getting started with VLANs
section_highlights.description: Instructions for setting up a VLAN.

section_highlights.title: About VLANs
section_highlights.description: Learn about VLANS and how they direct traffic to your resources.

tiles.title: UI Update and VLAN Trunking
tiles.description: Improved the UI and ordering experience. Also, added the ability to manage VLAN trunking from the UI.
